page.title: 03 PLACES OF INTEREST
page.content: { St.Mary's Church:}The Norman church of St.Mary stands on the site of a 7th century Saxon church which was destroyed by the Danes.Its spire was added in the 15th century.There is a Saxon Cross outside the south porch. There are several memorials inside the church to prominent Masham families- mainly the Danbys who were Lords of Masham from the 16th to the 19th centuries through to the Cunliffe- Listers, present holders and heirs to the Barony. the present incumbent of the Church is Rev.Frank Lindars. { College House:}This was the meeting place for the Peculier Court of the Prebend of Masham.It was an ecclesiastical court founded to deal with religious offences,licences to teach, probates,etc.King Henry 8th granted jurisdiction to the Master and Fellows of Trinity College Cambridge.
